Instruction: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large Dutch oven or oven-safe pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until softened and translucent.
Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional minute, until fragrant.
Add the chopped red bell pepper, yellow squash, and zucchini to the pot. Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until softened slightly.
Stir in the cubed eggplant and cook for another 5 minutes, or until the eggplant starts to soften.
Add the chopped tomatoes, fresh thyme sprigs (or dried thyme), bay leaf, salt, and freshly ground black pepper to the pot. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce heat to low and cover the pot. Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and the sauce has thickened slightly.

Optional Step (For a Layered Presentation):** While the vegetable mixture simmers, you can prepare the vegetables for a layered presentation (see note below).

Instruction: For a rustic presentation: Transfer the vegetable mixture to a serving dish and garnish with fresh basil leaves (optional).

For a layered presentation (optional):** Arrange the sliced vegetables (eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash) in a decorative pattern in a baking dish or oven-safe skillet. Carefully pour the cooked vegetable sauce over the top, ensuring all the vegetables are covered.
Bake the ratatouille for 20-25 minutes, or until the vegetables are heated through and the top is slightly golden brown (if doing the layered presentation).
Serve the ratatouille hot as a side dish or vegetarian main course. Enjoy!

Note:** For the layered presentation, you can pre-cook the sliced vegetables (eggplant, zucchini, yellow squash) in a separate pan with a little olive oil until softened slightly. This step is optional but can help ensure even cooking throughout the dish.
